section.name: Overview
section.p: The CIlib library comes bundled with a simulator application that may be used to execute algorithms, based on an XML specification document which is passed in as a parameter to th simulator.

This specification defines the required instances and values which will be used by the algorithm during it's execution. It should be noted that all properties have reasonable defaults already assigned to them. If you wish to override these values, they can be specified within the XML specification (this is true when using CIlib as a library directly within Java code as well).

CIlib has been designed following the JavaBeans specification (where it made sense to do so). As a result, all the configurable properties have getter anf setter methods exposed. This allows us to do some rather nice things using the default Java Introspection.
